title.rendered: A Step-By-Step Guide to Targeted Express Entry for Nurses

[vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding_phone=”15%” bottom_padding_phone=”15%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-5-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”7/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”]

[vc_column_text]“Can I immigrate to Canada as a Nurse with Targeted Express Entry?”

Yes, it is possible to migrate to Canada as a nurse through the Targeted Express Entry program in 2023. Are you a nurse aspiring for a fresh start in Canada? Curious about the potential to immigrate to the Great White North via the much-awaited Targeted Express Entry program? This is the right place to start!

As a nurse, your role in delivering healthcare services and promoting well-being is highly valued in various healthcare settings. The Canadian government acknowledges the significance of nurses and has included specific occupations in the Targeted Occupations List for this category.

The Targeted Express Entry Draws for Nurses will help eligible candidates secure a Canada PR Visa with a lower CRS score. In this detailed guide, we offer valuable information and insights for nurses who are keen on exploring immigration opportunities in Canada through the Targeted Express Entry program.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

What is Targeted Express Entry Category-Based Selection?

The purpose of the Express Entry system is to assist the Canadian government in efficiently handling applications for permanent residency. Its primary objective is to attract highly skilled workers who have the potential to make significant contributions to the country’s economic advancement. If you are a nurse, you are presented with a remarkable opportunity to acquire permanent residency in Canada through the Express Entry program, which offers a range of advantages and benefits.

In the category-based rounds of invitations, candidates are chosen based on specific criteria set by the Minister with the aim of attaining economic objectives. These criteria include language proficiency in French, and relevant work experience in specific Training, Education, Experience, and Responsibilities (TEER) categories outlined in the National Occupational Classification (NOC Version 2021).

Work experience in designated TEER categories is evaluated to determine an applicant’s suitability for immigration through the category-based rounds of invitations, assessing candidates against specific criteria set by the Minister to fulfill economic goals.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Targeted Express Entry for Nurses

In the category-based rounds of invitations, candidates in nursing occupations are selected based on specific criteria established by the Minister to fulfill economic objectives. Meeting the eligibility criteria for Targeted Express Entry also requires eligibility for one of the three economic immigration programs: the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Canadian Experience Class, or the Federal Skilled Trades Program.

Eligible Occupations for Targeted Express Entry Draw for Nurses

Candidates applying under the Nursing category must have accumulated at least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in a single occupation listed below.

Occupation NOC Code Work Experience Requirement
Nurse aides, orderlies and patient service associates 33102 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in the same occupation
Nurse practitioners 31302 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in the same occupation
Nursing co-ordinators and supervisors 31300 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in the same occupation
Registered nurses and registered psychiatric nurses 31301 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in the same occupation
Licensed practical nurses 32101 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in the same occupation

To ensure you correctly identify your NOC code and select the appropriate occupation category, it is highly recommended to seek assistance from professional immigration experts. Alternatively, you can visit the official website of the Canadian government to directly check the National Occupational Classification (NOC) codes.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14129″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Prepare for Targeted Express Entry with ELAAR!

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Let’s Talk” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

How to Apply for Targeted Express Entry as a Nurse?

You can apply for the Targeted Express Entry as a Nurse, follow these steps:

Determine your Eligibility:  Firstly, you need to be eligible for the targeted nursing occupations and have at least 6 months of continuous work experience in a single occupation listed in the Targeted Occupations List for nurses. Additionally, you must meet all the eligibility requirements from one of the three federal immigration programs.

Language Proficiency:  You must demonstrate your proficiency in English or French via language tests including the CELPIP or IELTS General test for English and TEF or TCF for French. You must score the minimum required bands.

Create an Express Entry Profile: Make an Express Entry profile and provide detailed information about your work experience, education, language proficiency, and other relevant details. Based on the information provided, you will receive a CRS score.

Improve Your CRS Score: Improve your CRS by scoring maximum points through language proficiency, education, work experience, and adaptability factors. You can gain more points by obtaining a provincial nomination through the Provincial Nominee Program (PNP).

Targeted Express Entry Draw: With high CRS scores in your Targeted Nursing occupation you can receive an Invitation to Apply (ITA) during the Targeted Express Entry Draws. If you receive an ITA, you can continue with submitting your application for permanent residency within the specified timeframe.

Submitting an Application: Submit all the required documents for your complete application. Make sure to compile everything correctly and submit the Targeted Express Entry application within the given timeframe.

Medical Examinations and Security Checks: You need to submit medical examination reports to ensure you meet the health requirements for immigration. Additionally, police and background checks will be conducted to ensure a safe and secure immigration process.

Application Processing: After submission, it will be processed within 4-6 months. Keep in mind that processing times may vary, but you can track the status of your application online.

To ensure a successful application process as a Nurse under the Targeted Express Entry program, it’s highly recommended to seek assistance from an experienced immigration consultant.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14130″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Discuss Your Express Entry Profile with ELAAR

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” open_new_tab=”true” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Enquire Now” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

How Does ELAAR Immigration Help Nurses?

ELAAR Immigration provides expert guidance and support to healthcare professionals, including nurses, navigating the Targeted Express Entry process. Our team of experts understands the unique needs and requirements of nurses in the Canadian healthcare system and is committed to maximizing your chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) as a nurse.

We will help to assess your Express Entry profile and identify areas that can be strengthened to enhance your CRS score. Our experienced consultants will guide you through the optimization of your work experience, education, and other factors to ensure your profile aligns with the specific requirements of the Targeted Express Entry Draw for nurses.

For a limited time, eligible nurses can sign up with us for as low as CAD $999 to benefit from our comprehensive services, including:

  • Submission of a complete and accurate Express Entry profile and/or PNP Expression of Interest
  • Support with preparing documents in advance in anticipation of receiving an ITA
  • One-on-one ZOOM appointment with an RCIC to discuss your personalized case
  • On-going support from an RCIC throughout the process and even after

Contact us today to benefit from our expertise and personalized assistance. Together, we can navigate the complex application process and increase your chances of a successful outcome.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-4-percent” column_padding_tablet=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_phone=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”left-right” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”4/12″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_raw_html]JTNDZGl2JTIwY2xhc3MlM0QlMjJtbC1mb3JtLWVtYmVkJTIyJTBBJTIwJTIwZGF0YS1hY2NvdW50JTNEJTIyMzgxOTE0NiUzQWIyYzNtMHIxYzklMjIlMEElMjAlMjBkYXRhLWZvcm0lM0QlMjI1NDY1NDI2JTNBdTJ4Mms4JTIyJTNFJTBBJTNDJTJGZGl2JTNF[/vc_raw_html][vc_custom_heading text=”Trending Stories” font_container=”tag:h3|font_size:26|text_align:left|color:%230a0a0a” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1644853159092{margin-top: 40px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}”][recent_posts style=”list_featured_first_row” columns=”1″ category=”all” order=”DESC” orderby=”date” image_loading=”default” blog_remove_post_date=”true” blog_remove_post_author=”true” blog_remove_post_comment_number=”true” blog_remove_post_nectar_love=”true” posts_per_page=”5″ post_offset=”1″][/vc_column][/vc_row]

excerpt.rendered: Are you a Nurse or Nursing assistant looking to immigrate to Canada through Targeted Express Entry? Here is a detailed guide on on Targeted Express Entry, eligibility criteria, and application process.
